show.title: The Mummy (1999)
show.headline: The sands will rise. The heavens will part. The power will be unleashed.

event.title: <show-title>The Mummy (1999)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Presented by Super Yaki
event.description:
This show is presented with our friends over at Super Yaki, an indie apparel company that has become a cinephile favorite according to Entertainment Weekly. They rule the internet.

We have a soft spot for 1999’s THE MUMMY, with its thrilling action sequences, sweeping romance, goofy sense of humor, exotic locales, and, of course, the pure, unbridled star power of Brendan Fraser and Rachel Weisz. So we’re inviting you to journey with us to Hamunaptra as we celebrate the 20th anniversary of one of our favorite pieces of ’90s popcorn cinema with THE MUMMY Movie Party.

An ancient curse. A supernatural monster. A bumbling librarian. A dude who definitely isn’t Indiana Jones. Join us for a night of grand, old-fashioned adventure.

So we’re inviting you to journey with us to Hamunaptra as we celebrate the 20th anniversary of one of our favorite pieces of ’90s popcorn cinema with THE MUMMY Movie Party.

show.title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
show.headline: Makes Ben Hur look like an Epic

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Monty pyton holy grail sp still

portraitHeroImage.altText: Monty python holy grail sp portrait

posterImages.altText: Monty python and the holy grail poster 01

event.title: <show-title>Monty Python and the Holy Grail</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Just say Ni!
event.description:
Greetings old women, it is I, Arthur, your king!

That's right, one of the greatest and most quotable movies of all time is getting the Movie Party treatment, which means you can get in on all the sword-fighting, coconut-clomping glory.

We'll have swords for everyone, coconut halves for you to bring your imaginary horses to life, onscreen lyrics so that you can sing-along with the Knights of the Round Table, and a test of will, dexterity, and might prior to the show to recruit some brave knights to our cause (don't go second-guessing your favorite colors, now).

So follow, but follow only if ye be men of valor. For the entrance to this Movie Party is guarded by a creature so foul, so cruel, that no man yet has fought with it and lived. Bones of full fifty men lie strewn about its lair. So, brave knights, if you do doubt your courage or your strength, come no further, for death awaits you all with nasty, big, pointy teeth.

posterImage.altText: Monty python and the holy grail poster mp

show.title: RRR #encoRRRe
show.headline: #encoRRRe presentations of the righteous historical buddy action epic

event.title: <show-title>RRR #encoRRRe</show-title>
event.headline: #encoRRRe presentations of the righteous historical buddy action epic
event.description:
Every year, Fantastic Fest brings you 8 unforgettable days jam-packed with exhilarating new movies, mind-melting forgotten film discoveries, and outrageous parties, all held in person at the world-famous Alamo Drafthouse South Lamar in Austin, TX, Sept. 22nd-29th.

For the better part of the last twenty years, director S.S. Rajamouli has been cranking out the most thrilling genre cinema, including FF2013 alum EEGA or the two-part BAAHUBAJI epic. With RRR (short for Rise! Roar! Revolt!), Rajamouli, in our estimation, has turned in a once-in-a-lifetime face-melting action picture full of peerless action set pieces that will leave you breathless.

Set in the early 1920s in a British-controlled India, a dastardly governor abducts a tribal songstress, setting town elder Bheem (N.T. Rama Rao, Jr.) on a revenge path. Within the colonial army, one-man supersoldier Rama (Ram Charan) is tasked with protecting the governor from insurgents at all costs... while unknowingly befriending Bheem. The bond between brothers is tested as fire and water converge on a path of righteous fury, leading to history-shaking events rarely depicted on-screen for Western audiences.

Join us for an unmissable #encoRRRe presentation of the most movie you'll see in 2022, or any other year. (Jake Isgar)

Presented in Telugu with English subtitles, and with a five-minute inteRRRmission.

event.title: <show-title>Grease</show-title> <event-type-title>Sing-Along</event-type-title>
event.headline: Say goodbye to our Sandra Dee
event.description:
All ticketing proceeds to go toward the Olivia Newton-John Cancer Wellness & Research Centre

Join us as we pay tribute to Olivia Newton-John with arguably her most iconic performance in GREASE. You know the gist: a guy and a girl's idyllic summer romance could blossom into a real deal relationship, if not for their tough-talkin' cliques. A classic in all senses of the word (which, as we've been told, is "Grease").

Sing-Along DCP courtesy of Paramount Pictures.

show.title: Drunken Master
show.headline: Jackie Chan's stuntin' international breakthrough

event.title: <show-title>Drunken Master</show-title>
event.headline: Jackie Chan's stuntin' international breakthrough
event.description:
Presented in Cantonese with English subtitles.

Hong Kong action pioneer Yuen Woo-ping (The Matrix; Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon) and martial arts superstar Jackie Chan burst onto the scene in 1978 with a one-two punch of kung fu masterpieces, and it was the second of these, Drunken Master, with its Keaton-esque slapstick and flawlessly choreographed fight scenes that would leave the biggest impact.

Jackie Chan plays Wong Fei-hung (a legendary Chinese folk hero who has also been portrayed on screen by Jet Li, Gordon Liu and Donnie Yen amongst many others), who is punished for his frequent troublemaking by being forced to study under the martial arts master Su Hua Chi (Yuen Siu-tien), notorious for his drinking as much as he is for leaving his students crippled. Wong proves himself an adept pupil, but his new skills are soon put to the test when his own father is targeted by a brutal assassin (Hwang Jang Lee, Snake in the Eagle’s Shadow). (Eureka Entertainment)

DCP courtesy of Sony Pictures Repertory.

show.title: Pet Sematary
show.headline: Sometimes dead is better.

event.title: <show-title>Pet Sematary</show-title>
event.headline: Sometimes dead is better.
event.description: Mary Lambert's 1989 adaptation of the Stephen King horror-literature classic stars Dale Midkiff as a veterinarian who, after suffering tragedy in his family, dips his toes into supernatural power he does not fully understand. Creepy kids, creepier animals and Fred Gwynne sporting a beyond-memorable Maine accent - PET SEMATARY is responsible for unleashing waves of nightmare fuel upon an unsuspecting generation of horror hounds. Just a mention of “Zelda” sends a shiver down the spine of those in the know. Don’t miss a chance to see this still spooky creepfest on the big screen via a 4K digital restoration.

event.title: <show-title>Dynasty 3D</show-title>
event.headline: The pop-out martial arts spectacular!
event.description:
When an emperor’s son is accused of treason against the throne, he ends up in a fight for his life against all comers. Directed by Mei-Chun Chang (REVENGE OF THE SHOGUN WOMEN), this pop-out martial arts spectacular stars Bobby Ming, Tao-Liang Tan, Kang Chin, David Wei Tang, and Ying Bai, who was given an award for Best Supporting Actor at the 1977 Golden Horse Film Festival.

3D DCP courtesy of Kino Lorber.

show.title: Ghostbusters (1984)
show.headline: Cross the streams into a spectral-blast of fun

event.title: <show-title>Ghostbusters (1984)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Classic movie, interactive props… mass hysteria!
event.description:
For nearly 40 years, GHOSTBUSTERS has held a special place in the hearts of moviegoers with its eye-popping special effects, iconic characters, and, of course, its cast of comedy heavyweights led by Bill Murray. So we want to show our love for this beloved blockbuster by throwing an epically spooky Movie Party.

We’ll have a bunch of ghostly goodies to help you get in on the fun, including some slime from Slimer himself, some Stay Puft marshmallows, and some glow necklaces you can wave around anytime the Ghostbusters use their proton packs (just don’t cross the streams).

Join us and cheer on Peter, Ray, Egon, and Winston in the fight against the slimy, spooky, supernatural spirits haunting New York City in this hilarious ’80s classic.

show.title: Drunken Master II
show.headline: The Fei-Hong legend continues with a kick

event.title: <show-title>Drunken Master II</show-title>
event.headline: The Fei-Hong legend continues with a kick
event.description:
Presented in Cantonese with English subtitles.

The film that cemented Jackie Chan’s iconic status as an action hero unlike any other pack a punch and brings a belly laugh in this eye-popping presentation taken from the original negatives! In turbulent China before World War I, the collapse of the Manchu Dynasty fuels violent uprisings and political chaos–the perfect setting for a grand-scale smuggling ring led by an unscrupulous British consul. When the ring plots to steal China’s crown jewels only one man, legendary “Drunken Fist” master Huang Fei-hung (Chan), possesses the courage and ferocity to stop the ruthless gang. (Warner Archive)

DCP courtesy of Sony Pictures Repertory.

show.title: Annie (1982)
show.headline: The movie of 'Tomorrow'

event.title: <show-title>Annie (1982)</show-title>
event.headline: The movie of 'Tomorrow'
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

Director John Hustion’s adaptation of the wildly popular Broadway play is the kind of film other musicals aspire to be. Fun, endearing, and filled with plenty of toe-tapping numbers, ANNIE is well-deserving of its iconic status.

In the depths of the 1930's, Annie is a fiery young orphan girl living in a miserable orphanage run by the tyrannical Miss Hannigan. Her seemingly hopeless situation changes dramatically when she is selected to spend a short time at the residence of the wealthy munitions industrialist, Oliver Warbucks. She quickly charms the hearts of the household staff and even the seemingly cold-hearted Warbucks, who decides to help Annie find her long lost parents. However, Miss Hannigan, her evil brother, Rooster, and a female accomplice, have other, more nefarious ideas for the red-headed orphan...

show.title: Goosebumps
show.headline: The stories are alive

event.title: <show-title>Goosebumps</show-title>
event.headline: The stories are alive
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

The beloved series of spooky children’s books comes to life in a hilarious and meta big screen debut. Teenager Zach Cooper (Dylan Minnette), upset about moving from a big city to a small town, finds a silver lining when he meets the beautiful girl, Hannah (Odeya Rush), living right next door. But every silver lining has a cloud, and Zach’s comes when he learns that Hannah’s mysterious dad is in fact R.L. Stine (Jack Black), the author of the bestselling Goosebumps series. It was bad enough having a grumpy and seemingly crazy neighbor, but things go from bad to worse when Stine’s monsters start jumping off the page and terrorizing the town.

GOOSEBUMPS brings all your favorite monsters from the books to life on the big screen, and they bring plenty of comedy and adventure along with them.

event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

Many of us have aged quite a bit since we first saw THE NEVERENDING STORY, the classic tale of a young boy who gets swept up in an enchanted fantasy novel. Day jobs, mouths to feed, bills to pay… when you’re an adult, it’s hard to make room for magic in your life.

But if we learned one thing from THE NEVERENDING STORY, it’s the importance of keeping magic, wonder, and imagination alive in our hearts and minds, regardless of age.

So take the journey back into Fantasia and re-live the story of Atreyu and his quest to save the realm from an evil force called The Nothing, all told through the eyes of Bastian, a bullied young boy reading along with the story who may be more integral to it than he realizes.

show.title: Coraline
show.headline: An adventure too weird for words

event.title: <show-title>Coraline</show-title> <event-type-title>3D</event-type-title>
event.headline: An adventure too weird for words
event.description:
A young girl (DAKOTA FANNING) walks through a secret door in her new home and discovers an alternate version of her life. On the surface, this parallel reality is eerily similar to her real life - only much better. But when this wondrously off-kilter, fantastical adventure turns dangerous, and her counterfeit parents try to keep her forever, Coraline must count on her resourcefulness, determination, and bravery to get back home - and save her family. Based on Neil Gaiman's international best-selling book.

Based on Neil Gaiman's international best-selling book, this gorgeous stop-motion adventure is a spooky and inventive story that the whole family will love.

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Mean Girls
show.headline: So Fetch!

event.title: <show-title>Mean Girls</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: This party's gonna be so fetch
event.description:
There's a Regina George in every high school in America. That's precisely why MEAN GIRLS is so relatable, and also why it's so important. Comedic goddess Tina Fey based the screenplay on a non-fiction book about the social patterns of teenage girls and then harvested those authentic situations for priceless nuggets of hilarity.

This movie is funny because it's true to life, although the cast, including Fey, Rachel McAdams, Lizzy Caplan, Amy Poehler and Lindsay Lohan (in the best role of her career), definitely had something to do with it. It's a portrayal of teen politics so accurate, it should be required viewing in every school across America. And given the stellar cast and hilarious script, it's easy to see why this movie so quickly earned a permanent place in our cultural lexicon, not to mention our everyday vocabulary.

It's is packed with great quotes, from the elegantly simple, "Boo, you whore," to Damian's trademark, "YOU GO, GLEN COCO!", and at these interactive shows, you can celebrate all of these lines and more. Plus, we'll be handing out themed props, because the limit on fun at these screenings does not exist.

It's a night guaranteed to be even better than a cake made out of rainbows and smiles, so whether you're a Plastic, a Mathlete or a Badass M.C., prepare yourself for a totally grool time.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

The assisted listening headset provides an amplified audio signal for those individuals who are hard of hearing. A 3.5mm headphone jack is available to drive hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants.
You may not enter a movie after it has started. If you show up to your desired screening late, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or for a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.
